raw_comment:
I notice that the average ‘First Leaf’ appearance starts in Texas in January. It ends in May at the top of the states.
I wonder why the May 'First Leaf' ends up halfway across the United States. I also wonder why they don't have Alaska and Hawaii. I wonder why the 'First Leaf' shows up faster in some places than others.
The story of this graph is telling what time spring is coming in areas in some spots.
 A catchy headline for this graph could be "May Flowers: An Evolution of Spring."
ace_sentences: The average first-leaf appearance starts in Texas in January.
The average first-leaf appearance ends in May in the northernmost states.
I wonder why the first-leaf appearance in May ends halfway across the United States.
I wonder why the graph does not include Alaska.
I wonder why the graph does not include Hawaii.
I wonder why the first-leaf appearance happens faster in some places than in other places.
The graph tells when spring comes in some areas.
A catchy headline for this graph could be "May Flowers: An Evolution of Spring".
